*If you have not yet received Board approval for this project to progress, please add in details on in this comment box as why this project is needed and when you would expect Board approval of the project.

Bacardi's Board would like to review and align to all Brands' Innovation pipelines. Projects are shared with the Board as part of annual reviews. If this project you are submitting was part of the pipeline shared with the Board, then you are fine to confirm the project has been aligned with them.
Brand Activation is expected to deliver $0.5m NSV or above in the first 12 months.
the recommended minimum first 12 months $NSV threshold is $0.5m.

the recommended minimum first 12 months $NSV threshold is $3m.
A Business Enabler is expected to deliver $3m or above of incremental NSV per region in the first 12 months.​
the recommended minimum first 12 months $NSV threshold is $3m.

* I confirm that I contacted the Packaging Development Manager and followed their instruction to qualify this promotional pack. Please contact the Packaging Development Manager, if not already done.

Please contact the Packaging Development Manager (details below) before BCA submission, to confirm if your project will be supported by a supply chain center. Alternatively the Packaging Development Manager will provide guidance on how to develop the project in your market.

Presentations to customers usually happen 9-12 months before the innovation is due on shelf. Check with commercial primos in your lead region to understand when the date is likely to be. If the customer meeting is in 3 months or less, and the project has not been through a BCV, then consider whether you will be ready in time for that customer meeting as you may not be able to provide all of the materials they require for listing.

Customers are key to unlocking distribution for our Innovations, Re-Packs and Promotional Packs. We must be ready to present detailed information on our projects to them, which can be 9-12 months before the on-shelf date. It is highly recommended Primos have passed BCV before they present to customers. To help manage expectations, it is recommended projects are kicked off 18-24 months BEFORE their planned on shelf date to best accommodate for customer meetings.

A Fearless Bet is expected to deliver $1m or above of incremental NSV per region in the first 12 months.​
the recommended minimum first 12 months $NSV threshold is $1m.

labels.shortDescription: Financial Threshold Not Met Default Text
labels.value: This project does not meet the $NSV threshold for incremental NSV per region in the first 12 months. Please provide some comments detailing why it does not meet the threshold.​

Geographical Extension (GE) is expected to deliver, PER REGION:

• $0.5m NSV+ in next 12 months for a ‘Simple’ GE (i.e. no packaging and/or liquid changes required).

• $2m NSV+ in the first 12 months for a Complex Geo Extension (i.e. requires packaging and/or liquid changes).

labels.shortDescription: Geographical Extension Financial Threshold Not Met
labels.value:
The value you have entered for Y1 NSV ($k) does need meet the expected Yr 1 NSV ($k) threshold – see green bar above.
Action: Please update the value entered, so that the Y1 NSV ($k) meets or exceeds the expected threshold. Alternatively, leave the value as is, and enter comments to Approvers in the box below, as to why this project should progress, even though it is below the expected threshold.
The threshold targets for Geo Extensions (GE), are the aggregation of all the markets participating in the GE, PER REGION, in the next 12 months. Please detail in your comments to Approvers, how your market is contributing to the regional targets, outlining other markets from your region participating in the GE, to give approvers reassurance it is driving scale. Please connect with your Regional Innovation Lead if you require information on other markets expected to extend the innovation to your region.

The threshold targets for Geo Extensions (GE), are the aggregation of all the markets participating in the GE, PER REGION, and this project might be for only one of those participating markets from the region. Please check with Project Leaders and Innovation Regional Leaders if you need further information.

labels.shortDescription: Geographical Extension Parent Project Help Text
labels.value: Link new Geo Extension Project to the original Innovation Project (Parent Project). For example, if ‘Amazing Innovation’ was launched originally in North America and a new Geo Extension Project was raised to extend to New Zealand, then the new Geo Extension for New Zealand would need to be ‘linked’ to the original North America Project (Parent Project). Projects are linked by selecting the ‘Parent’ Project from the drop-down list. Only applicable to Projects originally launched post FY20 (including FY20).

the recommended first 12 months $NSV threshold is $0.5m for Simple Geo Extension (no packaging or liquid changes required) and $2m for above for Complex Geo Extension (artwork and/or liquid changes required).

labels.shortDescription: Geographical Extension Sub Classification Help Text
labels.value: An “Innovation Geo Extension” is the extension of a product that originally launched in or after FY20 (01/04/2019). An “Other Geo Extension” is the extension of a product that originally launched before FY20 (pre 01/04/2019) and any Product Modification extension.

The threshold targets for Geo Extensions (GE), are the aggregation of all the markets participating in the GE per region in the next 12 months. Please detail in your comments to Approvers, how your market is contributing to the regional targets, outlining other markets that will also GE this innovation, to give approvers reassurance it is driving scale. Please connect with your Regional Innovation Lead if you require information on other markets expected to extend the innovation to your region.

labels.shortDescription: Project Development Costs To Date Help Text
labels.value: These are costs that have been spent on the innovation to this point. It includes costs spent on Research, Development of Liquid & Packaging and any marketing material created to support the launch (i.e. Agency fees)
Project's average GM% (Year 1 - Year 5)

Project Names in Innovator need to be less than 80 characters and follow a set naming convention which is

<'Full Brand Name'><'space'><'Description'><'space'><'Launch Year'>.

<'Description'> means choosing a part of the name that clearly describes the purpose or nature of the project. This can help stakeholders easily understand what the project is about.


Fictional examples of this naming convention are:
  • Bombay Sapphire Premium Citrus New Flavour FY24
  • Patron Prestige Blanco for GTR FY25
  • Angels Envy New Distiller's Blend FY26
  • Grey Goose & Patron Miniature Gift Pack FY24
  • Grey Goose Two Free Glasses VAP for UK FY26
  • New Inno to Capture Herbal Drinks in Africa FY26
  • New Non Alc Whisky Alternative FY27

Use this Project Name and the Project Number to communicate the project internally amongst the Project Team and Stakeholders.
<Full Brand Name><space><Description><space><Launch Year>

Promotional Pack: These are NON-PERMANENT SKUs, including Limited Edition Packs, Value Added Packs (VAPs), Hitch Hikers or Neck Tags. These items allow for price or value promotions. Please note – if your project is for a Limited Edition that has a change of Liquid, please select Business Enabler.
A Promotional Pack is expected to deliver $0.5m or above of incremental NSV per region in the first 12 months.​

labels.shortDescription: Promotional Pack Parent Project Help Text
labels.value: To enable Bacardi to track what the original project was, we need to link this current project with the original one. There are some tasks that happen 'behind the scenes', and by knowing the original project, it will make those tasks easier.
A Repack should deliver growth for the trademark, compared to if the Re-Pack had not happened.
Cumulative Size of Prize (Incremental NSV $000 USD Year 1 - Year 5)
Note: The dates below are American date format (month/day/year).
Please update this project event date, as the date you have entered is in the past.

The timings tracker below aims to help Project teams better understand the likely timings for their project.

• The first column, gives the Innovator suggested dates for the project, based on information from projects of a similar classification / scope.

• The middle column is for Primos to input dates they would like for this project.

• If the dates inputted by Primos are before the dates suggested by Innovator, the column on the right will indicate a risk and give Primos advice on what to do.

It is recommended you have passed through the BCV before presenting your innovation to customers. Please check with supply and commercial Primos you will have enough time to prepare the required customer presentation materials available for these meetings.

It is recommended you have passed through the BCA before presenting your innovation to customers. Please check with supply and commercial Primos you will have enough time to prepare the required customer presentation materials available for these meetings.
Note: Timings may change based on the Product Requirements you choose in the Overview section before BCA submission. Innovator suggested timings are refreshed post BCA submission.
Note: Timings may change based on the Product Requirements you choose in the Overview section on the Define phase before BCA submission. Innovator suggested timings are refreshed post BCA submission.
The Project Event date you have inputted is before when Innovator suggests. Please check with your project team (including supply, marketing and commercial), your inputted date is achievable.
